009package imagingbook.pub.hough;
010
011import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
012import java.util.ArrayList;
013import java.util.Collections;
014import java.util.List;
015
016import ij.IJ;
017import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
018import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
019import imagingbook.pub.hough.lines.HoughLine;
020
021
022/**
023 * This class implements the "classic" Hough Transform for straight lines.
024 * This implementation improves the algorithm described in the textbook in
025 * the way the accumulator is updated. Here, the quantity 1 is not added
026 * to a single accumulator cell but gets distributed over two neighboring
027 * (radial) cells to reduce aliasing effects. Thus we accumulate non-integer
028 * values and therefore the various accumulators are of type {@code float[][]}.
029 *
030 * 
031 * TODO: add bias correction
032 * 
033 * @author W. Burger
034 * @version 2018/12/04
035 */
036public class HoughTransformLines {
037
038        public static class Parameters {
039                /** Number of angular steps over [0, pi] */
040                public int nAng = 256;
041                /** Number of radial steps in each pos/neg direction (accum. size = 2 * nRad + 1) */
042                public int nRad = 128;
043                public boolean showProgress = true;
044                public boolean showCheckImage = true;
045                public boolean debug = false;
046        }
047
048        private final Parameters params;
049
050        private final int nAng; // number of angular steps over [0, pi]
051        private final int nRad; // number of radial steps in each pos/neg direction
052
053        private final int width, height; // size of the reference frame (image)
054        private final double xRef, yRef; // reference point (x/y-coordinate of image center)
055
056        private final double dAng; // increment of angle
057        private final double dRad; // increment of radius
058        private final int cRad; // array index representing the zero radius
059
060        private final int accWidth; // width of the accumulator array (angular direction)
061        private final int accHeight; // height of the accumulator array (radial direction)
062        private final float[][] accumulator; // accumulator array
063        private final float[][] accumulatorExt; // extended accumulator array
064        private final float[][] accumulatorMax; // accumulator, with local maxima only
065
066        private final double[] cosTable; // tabulated cosine values
067        private final double[] sinTable; // tabulated sine values
068
069        // -------------- public constructor(s) ------------------------
070
071        /**
072         * Creates a new Hough transform from the image I.
073         * 
074         * @param I      input image, relevant (edge) points have pixel values greater 0.
075         * @param params parameter object.
076         */
077        public HoughTransformLines(ImageProcessor I, Parameters params) {
078                this(I.getWidth(), I.getHeight(), params);
079                process(I, accumulator);
080        }
081
082        /**
083         * Creates a new Hough transform from a sequence of 2D points. Parameters M, N
084         * are only used to specify the reference point (usually at the center of the
085         * image). Use this constructor if the relevant image points are collected
086         * separately.
087         * 
088         * @param points an array of 2D points.
089         * @param width      width of the corresponding image plane.
090         * @param height      height of the corresponding image plane.
091         * @param params parameter object.
092         */
093        public HoughTransformLines(Point2D[] points, int width, int height, Parameters params) {
094                this(width, height, params);
095                process(points, accumulator);
096        }
097
098        // Non-public constructor used by public constructors (to set up all final
099        // members variables).
100        private HoughTransformLines(int width, int height, Parameters params) {
101                this.params = (params == null) ? new Parameters() : params;
102                this.width = width;
103                this.height = height;
104                this.xRef = width / 2; // integer value
105                this.yRef = height / 2; // integer value
106                this.nAng = params.nAng;
107                this.nRad = params.nRad;
108                this.dAng = Math.PI / nAng;
109                this.dRad = 0.5 * Math.sqrt(width * width + height * height) / nRad; // nRad radial steps over half the diagonal length
110                this.cRad = nRad;
111                this.accWidth = nAng;
112                this.accHeight = nRad + 1 + nRad;
113                this.accumulator = new float[accWidth][accHeight]; // cells are initialized to zero!
114                this.accumulatorExt = new float[2 * accWidth][accHeight];
115                this.accumulatorMax = new float[accWidth][accHeight];
116                this.cosTable = makeCosTable();
117                this.sinTable = makeSinTable();
118        }
119
120        // -------------- public methods ------------------------
121
122        /**
123         * Finds and returns the parameters of the strongest lines with a specified min.
124         * pixel count. All objects in the returned array are valid, but the array may
125         * be empty. Note: Could perhaps be implemented more efficiently with
126         * insert-sort.
127         * 
128         * @param amin the minimum accumulator value for each line.
129         * @param maxLines maximum number of (strongest) lines to extract.
130         * @return a possibly empty array of {@link HoughLine} objects.
131         */
132        public HoughLine[] getLines(int amin, int maxLines) {
133                makeAccumulatorExt();   // TODO: should not be here
134                findLocalMaxima();
135                // collect all lines corresponding to accumulator maxima
136                List<HoughLine> lines = new ArrayList<>();
137                for (int ri = 0; ri < accHeight; ri++) {
138                        for (int ai = 0; ai < accWidth; ai++) {
139                                int hcount = (int) accumulatorMax[ai][ri];
140                                if (hcount >= amin) {
141                                        double angle = angleFromIndex(ai);
142                                        double radius = radiusFromIndex(ri);
143                                        lines.add(new HoughLine(angle, radius, xRef, yRef, hcount));
144                                }
145                        }
146                }
147                // sort 'lines' by count (highest counts first)
148                Collections.sort(lines);
149                List<HoughLine> slines = lines.subList(0, Math.min(maxLines, lines.size()));
150                // convert the list to an array and return:
151                return slines.toArray(new HoughLine[0]);
152        }
153        
154        /**
155         * @return The reference point used by this Hough transform.
156         * @deprecated
157         */
158        public Point2D getReferencePoint() {
159                return new Point2D.Double(xRef, yRef);
160        }
161        
162        public double getXref() {
163                return xRef;
164        }
165        
166        public double getYref() {
167                return yRef;
168        }
169
170        /**
171         * Calculates the actual angle (in radians) for angle index {@code ai}
172         * 
173         * @param ai angle index [0,...,nAng-1]
174         * @return Angle [0,...,PI] for angle index ai
175         */
176        public double angleFromIndex(int ai) {
177                return ai * dAng;
178        }
179
180        /**
181         * Calculates the actual radius for radius index ri.
182         * 
183         * @param ri radius index [0,...,nRad-1].
184         * @return Radius [-maxRad,...,maxRad] with respect to reference point (xc, yc).
185         */
186        public double radiusFromIndex(int ri) {
187                return (ri - cRad) * dRad;
188        }
189
190        public double radiusToIndex(double rad) {
191                return cRad + rad / dRad;
192        }
193        
194        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
195
196        /**
197         * Returns the accumulator as a 2D float-array.
198         * @return the contents of the accumulator
199         */
200        public float[][] getAccumulator() {
201                return this.accumulator;
202        }
203
204        /**
205         * Returns the local maximum values of the accumulator as a 2D float-array
206         * (all non-maximum elements are set to zero).
207         * @return the local maximum values of the accumulator 
208         */
209        public float[][] getAccumulatorMax() {
210                return this.accumulatorMax;
211        }
212        
213        /**
214         * Returns the extended accumulator as a 2D float-array.
215         * @return the extended accumulator
216         */
217        public float[][] getAccumulatorExtended() {
218                return this.accumulatorExt;
219        }
220        
221
222        /**
223         * Creates and returns an image of the 2D accumulator array.
224         * @return a {@link FloatProcessor} image of the accumulator
225         */
226        public FloatProcessor getAccumulatorImage() {
227                return new FloatProcessor(accumulator);
228        }
229        
230
231        /**
232         * Creates and returns an image of the extended 2D accumulator array, produced
233         * by adding a vertically mirrored copy of the accumulator to its right end. 
234         * @return a {@link FloatProcessor} image of the extended accumulator
235         */
236        public FloatProcessor getAccumulatorImageExtended() {
237                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(accumulatorExt);
238                return fp;
239        }
240
241        /**
242         * Creates and returns an image of the local maxima of the 2D accumulator array.
243         * @return a {@link FloatProcessor} image of the accumulator maxima
244         */
245        public FloatProcessor getAccumulatorMaxImage() {
246                return new FloatProcessor(accumulatorMax);
247        }
248
249        // -------------- nonpublic methods ------------------------
250
251        private double[] makeCosTable() {
252                double[] cosTab = new double[nAng];
253                for (int ai = 0; ai < nAng; ai++) {
254                        double angle = dAng * ai;
255                        cosTab[ai] = Math.cos(angle);
256                }
257                return cosTab;
258        }
259
260        private double[] makeSinTable() {
261                double[] sinTab = new double[nAng];
262                for (int ai = 0; ai < nAng; ai++) {
263                        double angle = dAng * ai;
264                        sinTab[ai] = Math.sin(angle);
265                }
266                return sinTab;
267        }
268
269        private void process(ImageProcessor ip, float[][] acc) {
270                if (params.showProgress)
271                        IJ.showStatus("filling accumulator ...");
272                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
273                        if (params.showProgress)
274                                IJ.showProgress(v, height);
275                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
276                                if ((0xFFFFFF & ip.get(u, v)) != 0) { // this is a foreground (edge) pixel - use ImageAccessor??
277                                        processPoint(u, v, acc);
278                                }
279                        }
280                }
281                if (params.showProgress)
282                        IJ.showProgress(1, 1);
283        }
284
285        private void process(Point2D[] points, float[][] acc) {
286                if (params.showProgress)
287                        IJ.showStatus("filling accumulator ...");
288                for (int i = 0; i < points.length; i++) {
289                        if (params.showProgress && i % 50 == 0)
290                                IJ.showProgress(i, points.length);
291                        Point2D p = points[i];
292                        if (p != null) {
293                                processPoint(p.getX(), p.getY(), acc);
294                        }
295                }
296                if (params.showProgress)
297                        IJ.showProgress(1, 1);
298        }
299
300        private void processPoint(double u, double v, float[][] acc) {
301                final double x = u - xRef;
302                final double y = v - yRef;
303                for (int ai = 0; ai < accWidth; ai++) {
304//                      double theta = dAng * ai;
305//                      double r = x * Math.cos(theta) + y * Math.sin(theta);
306                        double r = x * cosTable[ai] + y * sinTable[ai]; // sin/cos tables improve speed!
307                        double ri = radiusToIndex(r);
308                        // accumulated quantity (1.0) is distributed to 2 neighboring bins:
309                        int r0 = (int) Math.floor(ri);  // lower radial bin index
310                        int r1 = r0 + 1;                                // upper radial bin index
311                        if (r0 >= 0 && r1 < accHeight) {
312                                double alpha = ri - r0;
313                                acc[ai][r0] += (1.0 - alpha);
314                                acc[ai][r1] += alpha;
315                        }
316                }
317        }
318        
319        /**
320         * Searches for local maxima in the extended accumulator but enters their
321         * positions in 'accumulatorMax'.
322         */
323        private void findLocalMaxima() {
324                if (params.showProgress)
325                        IJ.showStatus("finding local maxima");
326                int count = 0;
327                for (int ai = 1; ai <= accWidth; ai++) {        // note the range!
328                        for (int ri = 1; ri < accHeight - 1; ri++) {
329                                float vC = accumulatorExt[ai][ri];      // center value
330                                boolean ismax = 
331                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai + 1][ri]     && // 0
332                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai + 1][ri - 1] && // 1
333                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai]    [ri - 1] && // 2
334                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai - 1][ri - 1] && // 3
335                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai - 1][ri]     && // 4
336                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai - 1][ri + 1] && // 5
337                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai]    [ri + 1] && // 6
338                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai + 1][ri + 1];   // 7
339                                if (ismax) {
340                                        if (ai < accWidth)
341                                                accumulatorMax[ai % accWidth][ri] = vC; // take care of ai == accWidth
342                                        else
343                                                accumulatorMax[ai % accWidth][accHeight - ri - 1] = vC;
344                                        count++;
345                                }
346                        }
347                }
348                if (params.debug)
349                        IJ.log("found maxima: " + count);
350        }
351        
352        /**
353         * Creates the extended 2D accumulator array 
354         */
355        private void makeAccumulatorExt() {
356                if (params.showProgress)
357                        IJ.showStatus("making extended accumulator");
358                for (int ai = 0; ai < accWidth; ai++) {
359                        for (int ri = 0; ri < accHeight; ri++) {
360                                // insert original accumulator into the left side
361                                accumulatorExt[ai][ri] = accumulator[ai][ri];
362                                // insert a vertically flipped copy of accumulator into the right side
363                                accumulatorExt[accWidth + ai][ri] = accumulator[ai][accHeight - ri - 1];
364                        }
365                }
366        }
367        
368}
369
370
